title: Media Bias and Democratic Backsliding
text:
Motivation
President Trump calling out cities for high crime rates and deploying national guard to those cities to combat crime.

title: Media Bias and Democratic Backsliding
text:
Discrepancy
However, the actual crime rate tells a different story.

title: Media Bias and Democratic Backsliding
text:
Literature Review
It is already established that media bias exists:

Strong consensus on bias in “hard news” and politicized issues
Older research: less severe in “soft news” and objective topics
Partisan consumption patterns persist across all news types

title: Media Bias and Democratic Backsliding
text:
Test 1
Question: Do political leaders reduce media independence and increase media bias by creating biased narratives?

Unit of analysis: State-time
Dependent variable: Media bias: the difference between the actual crime rate and media coverage of the same crime type in a period of time
Intervention: Trump Truth Social posts
Expected outcome: Political leaders incite biased media coverage to achieve their own goals

title: Media Bias and Democratic Backsliding
text:
Literature Review (cont.)

Question: But how does the media bias from reality affect the support for democracy?
Backsliding leaders win elections when voters embrace the promise of disruptive changes
Better socioeconomic performance indeed provides more stable regimes,
But evidence that lack of such performance causes democratic backsliding remains limited.

title: Media Bias and Democratic Backsliding
text:
Main Argument
Partisan media bias that distorts reality reduces perceived performance, enlarging the gap between perceived and actual performance, leading to more support for drastic changes, and hence creating more room for democratic backsliding.

title: Media Bias and Democratic Backsliding
text:
Test 2

Unit of analysis: Country
DV: Democratic Backsliding
IV: Media Bias
Expected outcome: Media bias distorting reality reduces support for democracy

title: Media Bias and Democratic Backsliding
text:
Data Sources

Crime Rate: FBI Crime Data Explorer
Media Coverage: CNN and Fox News API
Media Bias: International media bias dataset from HuggingFace
https://huggingface.co/datasets/newsmediabias/news-bias-full-data
Democratic Backsliding: V-Dem indices
